The Mona Lisa, painted by Leonardo da Vinci in the early 16th century, is arguably the most famous painting in the world. It's housed in the Louvre Museum in Paris and attracts millions of visitors each year. The mysterious smile of the woman in the portrait has intrigued art lovers for centuries. 

ENDINPUT
BEGININSTRUCTION
Who painted the Mona Lisa and where is it housed? What makes this painting so intriguing?
Provide a reference.
ENDINSTRUCTION

The Mona Lisa was painted by the renowned Italian artist Leonardo da Vinci in the early 16th century. It is currently housed in the Louvre Museum in Paris, France, where it attracts millions of visitors each year. The painting's enigmatic quality, particularly the subject's mysterious smile, has captivated art enthusiasts and scholars for centuries, contributing to its enduring fame and intrigue.

Reference:
- Louvre Museum. (n.d.). Mona Lisa (Portrait of Lisa Gherardini, wife of Francesco del Giocondo). Retrieved from https://www.louvre.fr/en/oeuvre-notices/mona-lisa-portrait-lisa-gherardini-wife-francesco-del-giocondo
